name: Paprika Chicken Pasta
description: Paprika Chicken Pasta! â™¡ Spiced baked chicken with pasta tossed in a luscious and creamy paprika sauce. YUM.
keywords: paprika pasta, paprika chicken, weeknight dinner, pasta dinner, cozy pasta recipe, easy pasta recipe
recipeIngredient: a pinch of paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt
8 ounces farfalle (DeLallo brand is the best pasta, hands down!)

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a medium bowl with lukewarm water. Sprinkle some salt in. Soak the chicken breasts in the salted water for 15 minutes. (This purpose of this is for better flavor – if you are short on time, you can skip this.)
recipeInstructions.name: Brine the chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the chicken dry. Transfer to a baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle thoroughly with paprika, garlic powder, and salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through. Let the chicken rest before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Cook to package directions. Toss with oil and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic; saute for about 2 minutes. Add the flour; cook for about 2 minutes. Add the wine; stir and let it sizzle out. Add the broth, a little at a time, stirring between each addition. Add the paprika and the cream. Stir until bubbly and creamy enough to coat the back of a spoon. Season to taste with salt and lemon juice.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Toss the pasta with the creamy sauce. Arrange a sliced chicken breast on top. Sprinkle with parsley or red pepper flakes.
recipeInstructions.name: Assembly:Â

recipeYield: 2-4 servings (2 if you're hungry, 4 if you're reasonable)

video.name: Paprika Chicken Pasta
video.description: Paprika Chicken Pasta! â™¡ Spiced baked chicken with pasta tossed in a luscious and creamy paprika sauce. YUM.

review.reviewBody: Made this and loved it! Had no cream on hand so I used a mixture of milk and cream cheese, it was divine. Somehow I went through a whole bottle of wine, but I swear I was following the recipe ðŸ¤£
That looks delicious! I want to make that for my parents and my Sunday dinner.

Holy kazoo, is this delicious and easy! I panicked because it was dinner time and I had defrosted chicken but no ideas, so I made this and it was super easy (had everything in my pantry!) and absolutely jam packed with flavor. I added roasted onion, zucchini, and carrots (because why not) and the whole family loved it. Kind of already dreaming of the leftovers for lunch tomorrow, not gonna lie.

Delicious! I didn't have wine so I substituted for 1/8 cup water and 1/8 cup lime juice and used whole milk instead of cream and it worked like a charm (I just didn't add the other squeeze of lemon juice that is called for to avoid it getting too lemony). Definitely saving this one for the future!

This was DELICIOUS! I doubled recipe, used all chicken broth because I didn't have  white wine and sprinkled with parsley. TWO questions....I waited until the chicken breasts reached 165 before taking them out which ended up taking 20-25 min. They tasted a tad overcooked.  Should I remove the chicken at 15 minutes next time regardless if it's at 165 since it rests before slicing?    

My second question is, when doubling, should I also double the paprika for the sauce (I was nervous it would be too much when doubling). Thanks again for another great recipe!!

Love this! I always put paprika in my Mac and cheese so I figured this would be amazing and it was. I added 2 handfuls of cheddar cheese to the sauce before tossing it with the pasta and I loved the cheesy creaminess it added! Definitely will be making this again, thanks for the delicious recipe!

Made this recipe last week for my grands (10 & 13) and it was delicious. Made just as recipe stated. Very easy to follow. Chicken was moist and delicious. First time for chicken breasts in a long time because they always turned out dry. But the instructions for this recipe are perfect. So good that I made it again this week for my 22 year old granddaughter and she loved it. Only had smoked paprika on hand this time ðŸ˜¬ so just used 1 tsp and added a little more heavy   cream. Fresh lemon juice is a must for this recipe it pulls everything together nicely. Worked out great. 
Pasta with this wonderful sauce is fantastic. 

Thank you for this nice recipe. It is definitely one I will make many times.
Very yummy. Loved that I had everything at home already. Will make it again!!
Delicious and perfect for a weeknight dinner! I definitely recommend adding the red pepper flakes for some heat. Will make again.
This is one of my favorite dinners to make; it is SO easy and the sauce is dreamy. Thank you for the recipe!!

Excellent post! We are linking to this particularly great article
on our website. Keep up the good writing.
Can this be frozen (asking because of the cream....)
